byte-order.title: Byte Order Converter
byte-order.description: Convert between Big Endian and Little Endian
byte-order.aboutDesc: Endianness refers to the order in which multi-byte data is stored in memory. Big Endian stores the most significant byte at the lowest address, while Little Endian stores the least significant byte at the lowest address. x86/x64 architectures use Little Endian, while network protocols typically use Big Endian.

ieee754.title: IEEE 754 Floating Point
ieee754.description: View IEEE 754 binary representation of floating-point numbers
ieee754.aboutDesc: IEEE 754 is the international standard for floating-point arithmetic, defining the binary representation format for floating-point numbers. Single precision (float32) uses 1 sign bit, 8 exponent bits, and 23 mantissa bits; double precision (float64) uses 1 sign bit, 11 exponent bits, and 52 mantissa bits.
